description: Execute an expression as a process step.

___loadContents.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



Read up to the first 64 KiB of text from the file and place it in the

"contents" field of the file object for use by expressions.

___streamable.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



A value of `true` indicates that the file is read or written

sequentially without seeking.  An implementation may use this flag to

indicate whether it is valid to stream file contents using a named

pipe.  Default: `false`.

___format.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



For input parameters, this must be one or more URIs of a concept nodes

that represents file formats which are allowed as input to this

parameter, preferrably defined within an ontology.  If no ontology is

available, file formats may be tested by exact match.



For output parameters, this is the file format that will be assigned to

the output parameter.

___symbols.description: Defines the set of valid symbols.

___secondaryFiles.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



Describes files that must be included alongside the primary file(s).



If the value is an expression, the value of `self` in the expression

must be the primary input or output File to which this binding applies.



If the value is a string, it specifies that the following pattern

should be applied to the primary file:



1. If string begins with one or more caret `^` characters, for each

caret, remove the last file extension from the path (the last

period `.` and all following characters).  If there are no file

extensions, the path is unchanged.

2. Append the remainder of the string to the end of the file path.

___streamable.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



A value of `true` indicates that the file is read or written

sequentially without seeking.  An implementation may use this flag to

indicate whether it is valid to stream file contents using a named

pipe.  Default: `false`.

___inputBinding.description:
Describes how to handle the inputs of a process and convert them

into a concrete form for execution, such as command line parameters.

___default.description:
The default value for this parameter if not provided in the input

object.

available, file formats may be tested by exact match.



For output parameters, this is the file format that will be assigned to

the output parameter.

___items.description: Defines the type of the array elements.

___secondaryFiles.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



Describes files that must be included alongside the primary file(s).



If the value is an expression, the value of `self` in the expression

must be the primary input or output File to which this binding applies.



If the value is a string, it specifies that the following pattern

should be applied to the primary file:



1. If string begins with one or more caret `^` characters, for each

caret, remove the last file extension from the path (the last

period `.` and all following characters).  If there are no file

extensions, the path is unchanged.

2. Append the remainder of the string to the end of the file path.

___streamable.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



A value of `true` indicates that the file is read or written

sequentially without seeking.  An implementation may use this flag to

indicate whether it is valid to stream file contents using a named

pipe.  Default: `false`.

___format.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



For input parameters, this must be one or more URIs of a concept nodes

that represents file formats which are allowed as input to this

parameter, preferrably defined within an ontology.  If no ontology is

available, file formats may be tested by exact match.



For output parameters, this is the file format that will be assigned to

the output parameter.

___loadContents.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



Read up to the first 64 KiB of text from the file and place it in the

"contents" field of the file object for use by expressions.

___secondaryFiles.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.

_88ProcessRequirement.description:
A process requirement declares a prerequisite that may or must be fulfilled

before executing a process.  See [`Process.hints`](#process) and

[`Process.requirements`](#process).



Process requirements are the primary mechanism for specifying extensions to

the CWL core specification.

___streamable.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



A value of `true` indicates that the file is read or written

sequentially without seeking.  An implementation may use this flag to

indicate whether it is valid to stream file contents using a named

pipe.  Default: `false`.

___format.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



For input parameters, this must be one or more URIs of a concept nodes

that represents file formats which are allowed as input to this

parameter, preferrably defined within an ontology.  If no ontology is

available, file formats may be tested by exact match.



For output parameters, this is the file format that will be assigned to

the output parameter.

___streamable.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



A value of `true` indicates that the file is read or written

sequentially without seeking.  An implementation may use this flag to

indicate whether it is valid to stream file contents using a named

pipe.  Default: `false`.

___format.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



For input parameters, this must be one or more URIs of a concept nodes

that represents file formats which are allowed as input to this

parameter, preferrably defined within an ontology.  If no ontology is

available, file formats may be tested by exact match.



For output parameters, this is the file format that will be assigned to

the output parameter.

___items.description: Defines the type of the array elements.

___secondaryFiles.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



Describes files that must be included alongside the primary file(s).



If the value is an expression, the value of `self` in the expression

must be the primary input or output File to which this binding applies.



If the value is a string, it specifies that the following pattern

should be applied to the primary file:



1. If string begins with one or more caret `^` characters, for each

caret, remove the last file extension from the path (the last

period `.` and all following characters).  If there are no file

extensions, the path is unchanged.

2. Append the remainder of the string to the end of the file path.

___streamable.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



A value of `true` indicates that the file is read or written

sequentially without seeking.  An implementation may use this flag to

indicate whether it is valid to stream file contents using a named

pipe.  Default: `false`.

parameter, preferrably defined within an ontology.  If no ontology is

For output parameters, this is the file format that will be assigned to

the output parameter.

___fields.description: Defines the fields of the record.

___symbols.description: Defines the set of valid symbols.

___doc.description: A documentation string for this field

___loadContents.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



Read up to the first 64 KiB of text from the file and place it in the

"contents" field of the file object for use by expressions.

___expression.description:
The expression to execute.  The expression must return a JSON object which

matches the output parameters of the ExpressionTool.

___description.description: A long, human-readable description of this process object.

___requirements.description:
Declares requirements that apply to either the runtime environment or the

workflow engine that must be met in order to execute this process.  If

an implementation cannot satisfy all requirements, or a requirement is

listed which is not recognized by the implementation, it is a fatal

error and the implementation must not attempt to run the process,

unless overridden at user option.

$eref.description:
A process requirement declares a prerequisite that may or must be fulfilled

before executing a process.  See [`Process.hints`](#process) and

[`Process.requirements`](#process).



Process requirements are the primary mechanism for specifying extensions to

the CWL core specification.

___outputs.description:
Defines the parameters representing the output of the process.  May be

used to generate and/or validate the output object.

___streamable.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



A value of `true` indicates that the file is read or written

sequentially without seeking.  An implementation may use this flag to

indicate whether it is valid to stream file contents using a named

pipe.  Default: `false`.

___format.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



For input parameters, this must be one or more URIs of a concept nodes

that represents file formats which are allowed as input to this

parameter, preferrably defined within an ontology.  If no ontology is

available, file formats may be tested by exact match.



For output parameters, this is the file format that will be assigned to

the output parameter.

___description.description: A long, human-readable description of this parameter object.

___type.description: Specify valid types of data that may be assigned to this parameter.

___outputBinding.description: Describes how to handle the outputs of a process.

___secondaryFiles.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



Describes files that must be included alongside the primary file(s).



If the value is an expression, the value of `self` in the expression

must be the primary input or output File to which this binding applies.



If the value is a string, it specifies that the following pattern

should be applied to the primary file:



1. If string begins with one or more caret `^` characters, for each

caret, remove the last file extension from the path (the last

period `.` and all following characters).  If there are no file

extensions, the path is unchanged.

2. Append the remainder of the string to the end of the file path.

___id.description: The unique identifier for this parameter object.

___label.description: A short, human-readable label of this parameter object.

___hints.description:
Declares hints applying to either the runtime environment or the

workflow engine that may be helpful in executing this process.  It is

not an error if an implementation cannot satisfy all hints, however

the implementation may report a warning.

___inputs.description:
Defines the input parameters of the process.  The process is ready to

run when all required input parameters are associated with concrete

values.  Input parameters include a schema for each parameter which is

used to validate the input object.  It may also be used to build a user

interface for constructing the input object.

___streamable.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



A value of `true` indicates that the file is read or written

sequentially without seeking.  An implementation may use this flag to

indicate whether it is valid to stream file contents using a named

pipe.  Default: `false`.

___format.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



For input parameters, this must be one or more URIs of a concept nodes

that represents file formats which are allowed as input to this

parameter, preferrably defined within an ontology.  If no ontology is

available, file formats may be tested by exact match.



For output parameters, this is the file format that will be assigned to

the output parameter.

___description.description: A long, human-readable description of this parameter object.

___type.description: Specify valid types of data that may be assigned to this parameter.

___inputBinding.description:
Describes how to handle the inputs of a process and convert them

into a concrete form for execution, such as command line parameters.

___default.description:
The default value for this parameter if not provided in the input

object.

___secondaryFiles.description:
Only valid when `type: File` or is an array of `items: File`.



Describes files that must be included alongside the primary file(s).



If the value is an expression, the value of `self` in the expression

must be the primary input or output File to which this binding applies.



If the value is a string, it specifies that the following pattern

should be applied to the primary file:



1. If string begins with one or more caret `^` characters, for each

caret, remove the last file extension from the path (the last

period `.` and all following characters).  If there are no file

extensions, the path is unchanged.

2. Append the remainder of the string to the end of the file path.

___id.description: The unique identifier for this parameter object.

___label.description: A short, human-readable label of this parameter object.

___id.description: The unique identifier for this process object.

___label.description: A short, human-readable label of this process object.
